en.purpose: To calculate the pediatric age-adjusted shock Index (SIPA) and predict the risk of blunt injury in children with elevated SIPA.
en.use:
SIPA is the ratio of Maximum Heart rate to Minimum systolic BP in specific age groups. This is based on the fact that different age groups have a different normal range for the vitals.
Age Group             HR                        sBP                   Maximum normal SIPA
4-6 yrs                  65-110               90-110                           1.22
7-12 yrs                60-100               100-120                          1.00
13-16 yrs              55-90                 100-135                          0.90

Age Group              SIPA                        Risk for blunt injury
4-6 yrs                     > 1.22                            22%
7-12 yrs                   > 1.00                            25.1%
13-16 yrs                 > 0.90                            32%

Elevated SIPA is found to be associated with higher injury severity, increased risk of mortality, blood transfusion within 24 hrs, longer hospital stay
en.misuse: This should not be used in infants and toddlers and in injuries other than blunt injuries (for instance, it should not be used in penetrating injury risk assessment
